{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front Desk Officer / Receptionist",
  "description": "At Peakhire, we connect organizations with skilled candidates who fit your culture and goals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer / Receptionist

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Banking / Financial Services

Job Summary


	Provide front desk and customer support while assisting with basic banking transactions. This role requires excellent communication, customer service, and organizational skills, with prior exposure to bank teller operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Welcome and assist clients at the front desk
	Handle basic banking transactions and inquiries
	Maintain customer records and transaction logs
	Coordinate appointments and client meetings
	Manage phone calls, emails, and general correspondence
	Support office administrative tasks as required.


Requirements


	OND, HND, or BSc in Banking, Finance, Business Administration, or related field
	1&ndash;2 years of experience as a bank teller or front desk officer
	Good understanding of banking operations and customer service
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word)
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills
	Detail-oriented and professional.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;peakhire99@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-29",

  },

Front Desk Officer / Receptionist Job at Peakhire




        
    

        
        At Peakhire, we connect organizations with skilled candidates who fit your culture and goals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer / Receptionist

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Banking / Financial Services

Job Summary


	Provide front desk and customer support while assisting with basic banking transactions. This role requires excellent communication, customer service, and organizational skills, with prior exposure to bank teller operations.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Welcome and assist clients at the front desk
	Handle basic banking transactions and inquiries
	Maintain customer records and transaction logs
	Coordinate appointments and client meetings
	Manage phone calls, emails, and general correspondence
	Support office administrative tasks as required.


Requirements


	OND, HND, or BSc in Banking, Finance, Business Administration, or related field
	1–2 years of experience as a bank teller or front desk officer
	Good understanding of banking operations and customer service
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word)
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills
	Detail-oriented and professional.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: peakhire99@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Mechanic",
  "description": "Ocean Deep Drilling ESV Nigeria Limited (ODENL) - A joint venture partnership company which was formed by an indigenous provider of drilling rig services and a leading international drilling company that has created a world-class drilling company and is poised to deliver exceptional value to the exploration and production companies operating in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position of:

Job Position:&nbsp;Senior Mechanic

Job Location:&nbsp;Offshore, Nigeria

Job Requirements


	Associate&#39;s degree in Technical/Engineering Degree
	7 years of offshore experience in position as Mechanic experienced and trained on Hydraulic Systems troubleshooting and maintenance.


Candidates must meet the following requirements:


	Nigerian nationality;
	Professional experience in the Oil &amp; Gas industry is an added advantage;
	Academic qualifications equivalent to or in line with those required for the position; Availability to work offshore on a rotational schedule of 28/28 or 35/35 days.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and certificates to:&nbsp;info@odenl.com&nbsp;and copy&nbsp;stakeholder.recruitment@ncdmv.gov.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Senior Mechanic Job at Ocean Deep Drilling ESV Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Ocean Deep Drilling ESV Nigeria Limited (ODENL) - A joint venture partnership company which was formed by an indigenous provider of drilling rig services and a leading international drilling company that has created a world-class drilling company and is poised to deliver exceptional value to the exploration and production companies operating in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position of:

Job Position: Senior Mechanic

Job Location: Offshore, Nigeria

Job Requirements
     

            
    




	Associate's degree in Technical/Engineering Degree
	7 years of offshore experience in position as Mechanic experienced and trained on Hydraulic Systems troubleshooting and maintenance.


Candidates must meet the following requirements:


	Nigerian nationality;
	Professional experience in the Oil & Gas industry is an added advantage;
	Academic qualifications equivalent to or in line with those required for the position; Availability to work offshore on a rotational schedule of 28/28 or 35/35 days.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and certificates to: info@odenl.com and copy stakeholder.recruitment@ncdmv.gov.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HR / Admin Manager",
  "description": "Mainland Group Limited is a responsive shipping and logistics organization, offering comprehensive ports and terminal services to valued customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Admin Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Iddo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Oversee daily administrative operations and ensure smooth running of office activities.
	Maintain employee records, attendance, and leave schedules.
	Support recruitment processes &mdash; job posting, screening, interviews, and onboarding.
	Assist in drafting HR policies, employee handbooks, and internal communications.
	Liaise with vendors and service providers to ensure timely delivery and payment of office supplies and services.
	Prepare and process payment requests, purchase orders, and expense reports.
	Organize company meetings, trainings, and staff events; record and circulate minutes.
	Ensure compliance with company procedures and statutory HR regulations.
	Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and support management with HR reports.


Skills / Requirements


	Minimum of HND / B.Sc. in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
	Excellent organizational, multitasking, and interpersonal skills.
	Strong written and verbal communication abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Strong understanding of HR best practices and Nigerian labour laws.
	Ability to maintain discretion and handle confidential information.


Salary
N500,000 - N700,000 / month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@mainlandgroupng.com&nbsp;using &quot;Mainland Group HR &amp; Admin&quot; as the subject of the email.

Note: Wrongly titled applications will not be opened; only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",

  "validThrough": "2026-02-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "name": "Mainland Group"
    
  },

HR / Admin Manager Job at Mainland Group Limited




        
    

        
        Mainland Group Limited is a responsive shipping and logistics organization, offering comprehensive ports and terminal services to valued customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Admin Manager

Job Location: Iddo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Oversee daily administrative operations and ensure smooth running of office activities.
	Maintain employee records, attendance, and leave schedules.
	Support recruitment processes — job posting, screening, interviews, and onboarding.
	Assist in drafting HR policies, employee handbooks, and internal communications.
	Liaise with vendors and service providers to ensure timely delivery and payment of office supplies and services.
	Prepare and process payment requests, purchase orders, and expense reports.
	Organize company meetings, trainings, and staff events; record and circulate minutes.
	Ensure compliance with company procedures and statutory HR regulations.
	Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and support management with HR reports.


Skills / Requirements


	Minimum of HND / B.Sc. in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
	Excellent organizational, multitasking, and interpersonal skills.
	Strong written and verbal communication abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Strong understanding of HR best practices and Nigerian labour laws.
	Ability to maintain discretion and handle confidential information.


Salary
N500,000 - N700,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@mainlandgroupng.com using "Mainland Group HR & Admin" as the subject of the email.

Note: Wrongly titled applications will not be opened; only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Executive Assistant",
  "description": "Mainland Group Limited is a responsive shipping and logistics organization, offering comprehensive ports and terminal services to valued customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Iddo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	We are seeking a highly organized, proactive, and discreet Executive Assistant (EA) to provide high-level administrative and strategic support to the Executive Director.
	The ideal candidate will manage schedules, communications, and confidential matters while ensuring the Executive Director operates efficiently.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the Executive Director&rsquo;s calendar, meetings, and travel arrangements
	Prepare correspondence, reports, presentations, and meeting minutes
	Act as the primary point of contact between the Executive Director and internal/external stakeholders
	Handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion
	Coordinate meetings, follow up on action points, and track deadlines
	Assist with office administration and special projects as assigned
	Screen calls, emails, and requests, prioritizing appropriately


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an HND/BSc in Business Administration or related field&nbsp;with 1-2 years of experience.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Strong organizational and time-management abilities
	High level of confidentiality and professionalism
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
	Ability to work independently and under pressure


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@mainlandgroupng.com&nbsp;using &quot;Executive Assistant&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Executive Assistant Job at Mainland Group Limited




        
    

        
        Mainland Group Limited is a responsive shipping and logistics organization, offering comprehensive ports and terminal services to valued customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant

Job Location: Iddo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly organized, proactive, and discreet Executive Assistant (EA) to provide high-level administrative and strategic support to the Executive Director.
	The ideal candidate will manage schedules, communications, and confidential matters while ensuring the Executive Director operates efficiently.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the Executive Director’s calendar, meetings, and travel arrangements
	Prepare correspondence, reports, presentations, and meeting minutes
	Act as the primary point of contact between the Executive Director and internal/external stakeholders
	Handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion
	Coordinate meetings, follow up on action points, and track deadlines
	Assist with office administration and special projects as assigned
	Screen calls, emails, and requests, prioritizing appropriately


Requirements & Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an HND/BSc in Business Administration or related field with 1-2 years of experience.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Strong organizational and time-management abilities
	High level of confidentiality and professionalism
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
	Ability to work independently and under pressure


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@mainlandgroupng.com using "Executive Assistant" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
